RECORD.TEXT: 982404827 Unsigned DIS 04/10/1990 04/15/1990 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS ON DISCHARGE : CORONARY ARTERY DISEASE . This is a 73 year old white female with a history of pancreatic cancer treated with 5-FU and a vague history of chest pain , admitted with EKG changes of unclear duration , consistent with an anterior wall myocardial infarction . In March of 1989 , she presented with painless jaundice , and a workup included pancreatic cancer . Four months prior to admission , she had occasional band like chest pain across her entire chest . In January of 1989 , she was begun on 5-FU for five days of treatment followed by three weeks of no treatment . Two weeks prior to admission , she had a presyncopal episode but did not lose consciousness . There were no other symptoms . One day prior to admission , she was seen at the Dagreat Health for 5-FU , her third cycle . CARDIAC RISK FACTORS : Include smoking and increased cholesterol . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Includes (1) pancreatic cancer , status post a Whipple procedure , on 5-FU . (2) Status post a cholecystectomy , appendectomy , and hysterectomy . (3) Fibrocystic breast disease . Include 5-FU and Percocet for pain , Zantac , and Simethicone . She has no known drug allergies . She smoked up until ten years ago . She does not drink . On admission , includes a white blood cell count of 5.6 , hematocrit 37.4 , platelets 312 . The CK was 89 . The EKG showed a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 75 , axis -30 degrees , Q 's in V1-V3 , T-wave inversions in V1-V5 , new in comparison to June of 1985 . The chest x-ray showed a slightly increased cardiac size . An echocardiogram was done which showed apical septal akinesis , but with well preserved systolic function . Her medicines could not be increased beyond low doses secondary to a low systolic blood pressure . PROBLEM # 2 : The patient will be continued on her 5-FU as an outpatient , to be followed by Dr. Liermfelsbelb . Lumbosacral spines done during the admission did not show any change from x-rays done previously . HISTORY OF DIZZINESS . The patient complained of some dizziness and had a presyncopal episode prior to admission , however , the patient felt that her dizziness was unchanged from the dizziness that she had for several years . She had normal iron and TIBC . I suspect that this is anemia of chronic disease , but could not rule out gastrointestinal blood loss , although she remained guaiac negative . PROBLEM # 5 : PYURIA . The patient 8-10 white blood cells in the urine on admission , and the urine culture was no growth so far at the time of discharge . Include Pepcid 20 mg b.i.d. , Lopressor 25 mg b.i.d. , Diltiazem 30 mg t.i.d. , Isordil 10 mg t.i.d. , and Ecotrin one tablet p.o. q.d. She should arrange to be followed up by Dr. Liermfelsbelb . Her diet is a low cholesterol diet . ________________________________ IU058/5246 STISIE PAP , M.D. KT2 04/15/90 Batch : 6246 Report : 04/16/90 Dictated By :
